<td width="446" valign="bottom">AIESEC Concordia, originally an acronym for Association Internationale des Ãtudiants en Sciences Ãconomiques et Commerciales, is part of a global youth organization that develops leadership capabilities by facilitating international placements with both profit and non-profit organizations.<br>
<a href="http://aiesec.ca/concordia/" adhocenable="false">Website</a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Alternative Spring Break</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">Every February, Alternative Spring Break (ASB) offers students the opportunity to participate in a week-long service-learning experience in either a local or non-local setting.&nbsp; Students learn about different cultures, communities, and social issues while working in a hands-on manner with service organizations.<br>
<a href="http://asb.concordia.ca/" adhocenable="false">Website<br>
 </a><a href="http://www.facebook.com/asbconcordia?fref=ts" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Amnesty International Concordia</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">Amnesty International is a global movement of 2.8 million supporters, members and activists in more than 150 countries and territories who campaign to end grave abuses of human rights.&nbsp;The Concordia chapter works on bringing awareness to these causes.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://amnestyconcordia.wordpress.com/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://amnestyconcordia.wordpress.com/"><br>
 </a><a href="http://www.facebook.com/AmnestyConcordia" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Art Matters</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">Held annually during the month of March, Art Matters is a student-run festival that celebrates the vitality of the multidisciplinary artistic community. The festival promotes the development of emerging talent by creating connections to Montrealâs creative institutions, galleries and artist run centres. After more than a decade of effort from producers, curators, artists and interns, Art Matters has become the largest festival of its kind.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://artmattersfestival.org/" adhocenable="false">Website</a>&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://www.facebook.com/artmattersfestival?fref=ts" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>CASA Cares</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">CASA Cares is the non-profit segment of the Commerce and Administration Student Association (CASA) at Concordiaâs John Molson School of Business. It promotes social awareness and responsibility among students and regularly organizes fundraisers benefitting local non-profits and charities.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://www.casacares.com" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://www.casacares.com/"><br>
 </a><a href="http://www.facebook.com/CasaCares?fref=ts" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Centre for Gender Advocacy</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The Centre for Gender Advocacy is an independent, student-funded organization, mandated to promoting gender equality and empowerment particularly as it relates to marginalized communities. This mandate is achieved through on-going programming, campaigns, resources, services, and advocacy.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://genderadvocacy.org/" adhocenable="false">Website<br>
 </a><a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/155692997937262/?ref=ts&amp;fref=ts" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Centre for Human Relations and Community Studies (CHRCS)</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The Centre for Human Relations and Community Studies (CHRCS) is a community of practitioners, researchers, community members, students, and other learners dedicated to improving the quality of life in human systems.The Centre provides faculty and students a necessary vehicle to carry on the working relationship with the community by providing learning experiences, training, consulting, research and publishing services to groups, organizations and individuals.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://chrcs.concordia.ca/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://chrcs.concordia.ca/"><br>
 </a><a href="http://www.facebook.com/CHRCS" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Centre for Oral History and Digital Storytelling (COHDS)</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The Centre for Oral History and Digital Storytelling (COHDS) serves aa point of convergence for collaborative digital historical research, teaching, and publishing among faculty and students at Concordia, as well as members of local, national and international communities.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://storytelling.concordia.ca/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><br>
<a href="http://www.facebook.com/cohds" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Centre for the Arts in Human Development (CAHD)</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The Centre for the Arts in Human Development (CAHD) is a therapeutic, research, and clinical training centre, offering a unique program of creative arts therapies for people with various types of developmental disabilities. Its public education mandate about disabilities and the arts involves original theatre productions, open houses and educational community-based projects.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://cahd.concordia.ca/" adhocenable="false">Website</a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Centre for the Study of Learning and Performance (CSLP)</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The Centre for the Study of Learning and Performance&nbsp;is is a multi-institutional research centre. It aims to&nbsp;develop evidenced-based tools and strategies that positively impact prekindergarten to secondary education, postsecondary education, corporations and industry, health and social services and the NGO/community sector.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://doe.concordia.ca/cslp/cslp_cms/" adhocenable="false">Website</a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Cinema Politica Concordia</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">Founded at Concordia, Cinema Politica is is a media arts, non-profit network of community and campus locals that screen independent political film and video by Canadian and international artists throughout Canada and abroad. Each semester, programming is focused on social justice, environmental and cultural identity issues, and all screenings aim to bridge political independent filmmaking, local activism and civic education and engagement.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://www.cinemapolitica.org/concordia" adhocenable="false">Website</a>&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://www.facebook.com/groups/4823277121/?fref=ts" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>CJLO Radio</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">CJLO 1690 AM is Concordiaâs campus-community radio station and the only English-language radio station in Montreal that offers independent and underground music programming. CJLO also hosts events throughout the city to help promote and support the community and musicians.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://www.cjlo.com/" adhocenable="false">Website<br>
 </a><a href="http://www.facebook.com/cjlo1690am?fref=ts" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Colors of Concordia</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">Colors of Concordia is a group comprised of students, faculty, staff and alumni that aims to promote projects that help bring a greater understanding between cultures. The Colors of Concordia Cultural Initiative Fund supports initiatives that further the organization's goal.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://coloursofconcordia.ca/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://coloursofconcordia.ca/"><br>
 </a><a href="http://www.facebook.com/ColorsOfConcordia" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Community-University Research Exchange (CURE)</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The Community-University Research Exchange (CURE) broadens the kind of academic work available to students and gives community organizations, specifically those which experience social and economic marginalization, access to the knowledge and resources circulating in the academic sphere. Through CURE, students may volunteer to do socially-relevant academic research for the benefit of local non-profit organizations.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://curemontreal.org/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><br>
<a href="http://www.facebook.com/CUREMontreal" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Concordia Community Solidarity Co-op Bookstore</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The Concordia Community Solidarity Co-op Bookstore is student-led, independent, non-profit bookstore that&nbsp;serves the student community&nbsp;and the community at large.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://www.co-opbookstore.ca/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://www.co-opbookstore.ca/"><br>
 </a><a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/Concordia-Co-op-Bookstore/192550740762646?id=192550740762646&amp;sk=info" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Concordia Dans La Rue / DART 481 Design Outreach Course</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">Concordia Dans La Rue is an educational outreach initiative between Associate Professor, PK Langshaw, and Dans La Rue, an organization which serves youth on the street. The DART 481 course is instructed by Faculty Lecturer, Israel Dupuis, who creates outreach programs with local educational and empowerment centres. For the Department of Design, &quot;being on the street&quot; means creating links with Montreal communities via student internships, collaborative projects, and public artworks.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://danslarue.concordia.ca/" adhocenable="false">Website</a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Concordia Greenhouse</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The Concordia Greenhouse Project is a collectively-run organization that provides a setting for workshops, film screenings, research projects, and community events. It grows food and tea plants year-round and it has recently transformed its outdoor gardens into urban agriculture training sites, where participants from City Farm School work with trained horticulturalists.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://concordiagreenhouseproject.wordpress.com/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://concordiagreenhouseproject.wordpress.com/"><br>
 </a><a href="https://www.facebook.com/concordia.greenhouse" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Concordia International Community Outreach Program (iCOP)</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">iCOPâs goal is to create concrete opportunities for students to become informed, engaged and actively involved in international development. By focusing on economic, social and environmental issues, iCOP aims to enable students to put words into actions so that they may become global citizens and social leaders.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://www.concordiaicop.com/" adhocenable="false">Website</a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Concordia HIV/AIDS Project</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The Concordia HIV/AIDS Project was founded in 1993 and has now grown into four interrelated programs and initiatives including the HIV/AIDS Community Lecture Series, Concordia Community HIV/AIDS Courses, and HIV/AIDS Community Internships.<br>
<a href="http://aids.concordia.ca/aboutus.html" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://aids.concordia.ca/aboutus.html" adhocenable="false"><br>
 </a><a href="http://www.facebook.com/hivaids.concordia?fref=ts" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Concordia University Television (CUTV)</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">Established in 1969, CUTV is Concordia's campus-community television station that gives a voice to Montreal's underrepresented communities. It&nbsp;creates and&nbsp;produces video, and&nbsp;broadcasts live over the internet.<br>
<a href="http://cutvmontreal.ca/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://cutvmontreal.ca/"><br>
 </a><a href="http://www.facebook.com/CUTVmontreal" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Concordia Volunteers Abroad Program (CVAP)</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">CVAP was&nbsp;established on the belief that engagement in community development programs can successfully assist with issues relating to the various dimensions of underdevelopment. Since its induction, CVAP has continuously provided individuals with the opportunity to volunteer in Gulu, Uganda, while simultaneously building partnerships with various community organizations.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://www.concordiavolunteers.org/" adhocenable="false">Website<br>
 </a><a href="http://www.facebook.com/pages/Concordia-Volunteer-Abroad-Program-CVAP/409045159213046" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a><br>
</td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>David O'Brien Centre for Sustainable Enterprise (DOCSE)</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The mission of the David OâBrien Centre for Sustainable Enterprise (DOCSE) is to be the leader in developing business practices that support corporate social responsibility, environmental health and safety environmental management, community, and greening activities in a holistic and systemic way.&nbsp;It explores issues related to sustainable enterprise, shapes curriculum development, and trains the next generation of researchers and business leaders.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://johnmolson.concordia.ca/en/faculty-research/research-centres/david-obrien-centre-for-sustainable-enterprise" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://johnmolson.concordia.ca/en/faculty-research/research-centres/david-obrien-centre-for-sustainable-enterprise"><br>
 </a><a href="https://www.facebook.com/cvap.uganda?fref=ts" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Engineers Without Borders (EWB)</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">Engineers Without Borders (EWB) Concordia&nbsp;is a non-profit organization, supported by professional engineers, students, and volunteers in Canada and abroad.&nbsp;EWB works with local organizations, offering experience and knowledge to assist development. Its main areas of focus are education, communication, and innovation.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://concordia.ewb.ca/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://concordia.ewb.ca/"><br>
 </a><a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/Engineers-Without-Borders-Concordia-Chapter/265816049349" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Frontier College</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">Frontier College at Concordia organizes reading circles, homework clubs and one-on one tutoring in collaboration with community partners in Little Burgundy, and the NDG-CDN area. Volunteers work to directly improve literacy levels among children and adult learners and can also take part in management and administrative tasks within an on-campus committee.<br>
<a href="http://www.frontiercollege.ca/concordia/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://www.frontiercollege.ca/concordia/"><br>
 </a><a href="https://www.facebook.com/collegefrontiere.montreal.qc?fref=ts" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Humanitarian Awareness of Concordia University (HACU)</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">Humanitarian Awareness Concordia University's (HACU) aims to educate young people about global poverty and international development. It strives to initiate and support humanitarian relief efforts by spreading awareness on various human rights issues and to provide students with experiential learning opportunities.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://www.hacu.ca/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://www.hacu.ca/"><br>
 </a><a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/154537871253488/?fref=ts" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Institute for Community Entrepreneurship and Development (ICED)</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The Institute for Community Entrepreneurship and Development (ICED) provides opportunities for members of Aboriginal, Black, ethnic and immigrant communities to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to improve their situation as well as the economic and social conditions in their communities. ICED achieves its mission by engaging key representatives and organizations within these communities, conducting research and providing managerial tools and training that will facilitate social and economic development.<br>
<a href="http://www.icedportal.com/" adhocenable="false">ICED website</a><a href="http://www.icedportal.com/"><br>
 </a><a href="http://johnmolson.concordia.ca/en/faculty-research/research-centres/institute-community-entrepreneurship-development" adhocenable="false">ICED JMSB website</a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Journalists for Human Rights (JHR)</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The goal of Journalists for Human Rights (JHR) is to make everyone in the world fully aware of their rights. By mobilizing the media to spread human rights awareness, JHR informs people about their rights, empowering marginalized people to stand up, speak out, and protect themselves.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://jhrconcordia.com/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://jhrconcordia.com/"><br>
 </a><a href="https://www.facebook.com/jhrConU" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>La Ruche d'Art</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">La Ruche d'Art is a free community art studio and science shop open to the general public. Its mission is to make art more accessible, strengthen links between community members and celebrate diversity, through dialogue, art making and gardening.<br>
No website.<br>
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/La-Ruche-dArt-St-Henri/174341355959676" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Le Frigo Vert</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">Le Frigo Vert is a cooperative and store that sells organic bulk and pre-packaged food, alternative health products, and environmentally-thoughtful cleaning supplies. It strives to make nutritious, affordable food accessible along with recipes and information about medicinal herbs. The store serves the student population as well as the community at large.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://www.lefrigovert.com/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://www.lefrigovert.com/"><br>
 </a><a href="https://www.facebook.com/lefrigo.vert" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>LIVE Centre</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The LIVE Volunteer Resource Centre is a &quot;one-stop shop&quot; for information about volunteering, both within and outside of Concordia. Acting as a liaison service, the Centre bridges community organizations, student groups and departments who seek to recruit volunteers within the Concordia community.<br>
<a href="http://volunteer.concordia.ca/newsandevents/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://volunteer.concordia.ca/newsandevents/"><br>
 </a><a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/Concordia-LIVE-Centre/107122669341798" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>MBA Community Service Initiave (CSI)</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The MBA Community Service Initiative encourages and promotes community service and links the resources of the John Molson Business School with the needs of communities, organizations, small businesses, institutions, and industries.&nbsp; Communities can request volunteer assistance for specific projects and/or provide service opportunities.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://johnmolson.concordia.ca/en/graduate-programs/mba-program/beyond-the-classroom/1137-mba-community-service-initiative" adhocenable="false">Website</a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Montreal Institute For Genocide and Human Rights Studies (MIGS)</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The Montreal Institute for Genocide and Human Rights Studies (MIGS) is recognized internationally as Canada's preeminent centre for the study of genocide and crimes against humanity. MIGS strives to establish and manage major research programs focused on the prevention and prosecution of genocide and other crimes against humanity.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://migs.concordia.ca/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://migs.concordia.ca/"><br>
 </a><a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/Montreal-Institute-for-Genocide-and-Human-Rights-Studies/239185039506816" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Mother Hubbard's Cupboard</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom"><p>Mother Hubbardâs Cupboard is a weekly vegan meal from September to early December and January to early April. It is open to students and community members alike.<br>
<a href="http://chaplaincy.concordia.ca/service/" adhocenable="false">Website</a></p>
</td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Peopleâs Potato</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The People's Potato is a collectively-run soup kitchen that offers vegan meals to students and community members on a by-donation basis.They are committed to educating about healthy cooking and food politics and to broader goals of social and environmental justice.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://www.peoplespotato.com/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://www.peoplespotato.com/"><br>
 </a><a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/Peoples-Potato/108188652546181" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>QPIRG Concordia</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The Quebec Public Interest Research Group (QPIRG) at Concordia is a resource centre for student and community research. It supports grassroots activism around diverse social and environmental issues through a wide variety of working groups. QPIRG seeks to establish campus-community links and inspire social change through inclusive and non-hierarchical engagement.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://www.qpirgconcordia.org/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://www.qpirgconcordia.org/"><br>
 </a><a href="https://www.facebook.com/QPIRGConcordiaGRIPConcordia" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Sense Lab</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The Sense Lab is composed of artists, academics, researchers, dancers, writers who work together to explore the active passage between research and creation. It holds monthly reading groups as well as a bi-monthly speaker-series entitled Bodies-Bits///Corps-DonnÃ©es which is a platform for the exploration of work in progress both local and international.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://senselab.ca/wp2/" adhocenable="false">Website</a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Le/The Sensorium</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">le/the Sensorium presents participatory public art events with the goal of creating community through shared affective-sensorial experiences. Featuring a menu of seasonal artists, le/the Sensorium excites, surprises and challenges the senses of tourists and locals of Montreal, Canada.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://www.lesensorium.com/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://www.lesensorium.com/" adhocenable="false"><br>
 </a><a href="http://www.facebook.com/LeTheSENSORIUM" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Sustainable Concordia</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">Sustainable Concordia is a nexus that engages students, staff, faculty, and administrators to work together in non-hierarchical, consensus based decision-making processes to address issues of sustainable development on campus. It has a number of working groups and serves as a springboard for sustainable initiatives around campus.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://sustainable.concordia.ca/" adhocenable="false">Website</a><a href="http://sustainable.concordia.ca/"><br>
 </a><a href="https://www.facebook.com/SustainableConcordia" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>Sustainable Internship Program</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The Sustainable Internship Program is a collaborative program developed by the David OâBrien Centre for Sustainable Enterprise and the John Molson School of Business (JMSB) Career Management Services (CMS). It gives undergraduate and graduate students at JMSB the opportunity to gain valuable and related experience within the domain of sustainability. Internship positions offer exposure to practices related to sustainability, CSR, ethics, diversity, social economy, socio-economic development and other issues.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://johnmolson.concordia.ca/career-services/employers/sustainable-internship-program" adhocenable="false">Website</a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>The Neighbourhood Theatre (TNT) project</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The Neighourhood Theatre (TNT) project draws inspiration from the work of oral historians, activists, and artists from various disciplines who are engaged in social innovation. &nbsp;It creates fun, intimate, locally based theatre and web-based digital stories in collaboration with neighbourhood residents, businesses, groups, and social service organizations in Montreal. Venues include libraries, coffee shops, art galleries, yoga studios, or other found spaces.&nbsp;<br>
<a href="http://oralhistory.concordia.ca/TNT/" adhocenable="false">Website</a></td>
</tr><tr><td width="194" valign="bottom"><p>University of the Streets CafÃ©</p>
</td>
<td width="446" valign="bottom">The University of the Streets CafÃ© organizes public conversations in cafÃ©s and community spaces across Montreal. The program is free and open to participants of all ages, all backgrounds, and all levels of education. Without grades or diplomas, the University of the Streets CafÃ© reinvents the idea of the âuniversityâ by creating spaces for lifelong learning, critical thinking, knowledge-building and community engagement.<br>
<a href="/campus-life/streets-cafe.html" adhocenable="false">Website</a><br>
<a href="http://www.facebook.com/UnivCafe" adhocenable="false"><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/icons/icon-facebook.png"></a></td>

    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));

                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));

            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Hingston Hall</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="title section">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h2>Loyola campus</h2>
</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/hingston3.jpg"></p>
<p><b>Hingston Hall (HA)</b>&nbsp;is a traditional residence housing 131 students located on the Loyola Campus of the university. Large single, single and double rooms are available with communal single gender washrooms on each floor. Facilities in this residence include&nbsp;<b>common kitchenette lounges</b>&nbsp;equipped with microwave ovens, toaster, kettle, coffeemaker and cable television (on each floor), a&nbsp;<b>television room</b>&nbsp;with piano, a games room, weight room, fully networked&nbsp;<b>study room</b>, and<b>&nbsp;laundry facilities</b>.</p>
<h3>At a glance</h3>
<ul>
<li>Furnished with a bed, desk, chair, filing cabinet, two night tables, armoire and mini - fridge.</li>
<li>Single or double occupancy.</li>
<li>Meal plan.</li>
<li>Resident Assistants living in house</li>
<li><b>Furnished</b>&nbsp;with a bed, desk, chair, filing cabinet, two night tables, armoire and mini-fridge.</li>
<li><b>Telephone</b>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<b>internet</b>&nbsp;services can be&nbsp;<b>purchased</b>&nbsp;through an independent service provider.</li>
<li>Cable service in all common rooms with a television.</li>
<li>Study room with&nbsp;<b>computers</b>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<b>Internet access.</b></li>
<li>Dining hall</li>
<li>Located next door to the Concordia Sports Complex</li>
<li><b>Security</b>&nbsp;rounds on a 24/7 basis</li>
</ul>
<p><b><br>
Hingston Hall (HB)</b>&nbsp;is a newly renovated addition to Hingston Hall. This coed residence will house 118 first-year full-time undergraduate students. Large single and single rooms are available with communal gender designated washrooms on each floor. Facilities on this side of Hingston Hall include common kitchenette lounges equipped with microwave ovens, toaster, kettle, coffeemaker and cable television (on each floor), a games room, and laundry facilities (with iron and ironing board).</p>
<p>Furnishing for each student includes a single bed, double bed in large single rooms (including the mattress), dresser, mini fridge, desk, chair, and armoire. A ceiling fan is provided in each room. Internet and telephone services are provided in all rooms and included in the cost of the rent.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Jesuit Residence</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="title section">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h2>Loyola campus</h2>
</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><img src="/content/dam/concordia/images/jesuit2.jpg"></p>
<p>Jesuit Residence is a modern 7-storey residence housing 52 students located on the Loyola Campus of the university. This residence has single rooms with private bathrooms. There is a centrally located kitchenette, TV lounge, reading/study room, game room and laundry facilities within the complex. Rooms in the Jesuit Residence are equipped with VOIP telephone and internet service.<i>There is one room equipped for a student with special needs</i>. This facility is wheel chair accessible.</p>
<h3>At a glance</h3>
<ul>
<li>Private room with shower, toilet and sink</li>
<li>Furnished with a double bed, desk, chair, bookcase, lounge chair, closet and mini-fridge</li>
<li>Internet and telephone service in each room</li>
<li>Meal plan</li>
<li>Resident Assistants living in the building</li>
<li>TV/Social lounge with panoramic view of the city</li>
<li>Common room/kitchenette with coffee maker, toaster, kettle and microwave oven</li>
<li>Community kitchen</li>
<li>Security rounds on a 24-7 basis</li>
<li>Dining hall</li>
<li>Located next door to the Concordia University Sports Complex</li>
</ul>

</div></div>

    <hr>

            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

    
    <div class="container">

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Our recruitment team makes sure you and your family receive personal attention when you consider attending Concordia. They are here to give you the right information about Concordia so you can make the best decision for your future.</p>
<p>There are so many ways to connect with Concordia recruiters. You can meet them at schools around the world. You can email, talk on the phone, take a tour, or keep in touch with them on Facebook and Twitter. Please donât hesitate to contact us by emailing <i><a href="mailto:study@concordia.ca" adhocenable="false">study@concordia.ca</a></i>.</p>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

    <script type="text/javascript">
	$ = jQuery;
	$(document).ready(function() {
	    $('#tabs a:first').tab('show');
	    var hash = window.location.hash;
	    if (hash == undefined || hash == ""){
	      var previouslyActive = getCookie("concordia-component-tab-active-tab");
          if (previouslyActive != undefined) hash = previouslyActive;
	    }
	    hash && $('ul.nav a[href="' + hash + '"]').tab('show');

	    $('.nav-tabs a').click(function (e) {
	        $(this).tab('show');
	        var scrollmem = $('body').scrollTop();
	        window.location.hash = this.hash;
	        $('html,body').scrollTop(scrollmem);
	        setCookie("concordia-component-tab-active-tab", this.hash, 1);
	    });
	});
        /** COOKIE GETTER AND SETTER FUNCTIONS **/
    function setCookie(c_name,value,exdays){
        var exdate=new Date();
        exdate.setDate(exdate.getDate() + exdays);
        var c_value=escape(value) + ((exdays==null) ? "" : "; expires="+exdate.toUTCString());
        document.cookie=c_name + "=" + c_value;
    }
    function getCookie(c_name){
      var c_value=document.cookie;
      var c_start=c_value.indexOf(" " + c_name + "=");
      if (c_start == -1)	{
        c_start=c_value.indexOf(c_name + "=");
      }
      if (c_start == -1){
        c_value=null;
      } else {
        c_start=c_value.indexOf("=", c_start) + 1;
        var c_end=c_value.indexOf(";", c_start);
        if (c_end == -1){
          c_end=c_value.length;
        }
        c_value=unescape(c_value.substring(c_start,c_end));
      }
      return c_value;
    }
	</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

	var mboxId = 'content-concordia-en-research-reuse-research-content-main-picker';
	var mboxName = 'content-concordia-en-research-reuse-research-content-main-picker';
	var mboxLocation = '/content/concordia/en/research/reuse-research/jcr:content/content-main/picker';
	var wcmMode = 'DISABLED';

	if ( typeof mboxDefine == 'function' && wcmMode !== 'ANALYTICS' ) {
		var callParameters = [ mboxId ];
		var callFunction;
		var replaced = false;
	
		
				callFunction = mboxCreate;
		
		
		
		var staticParameters = {};
		
		for ( var key in staticParameters )
			callParameters.push(key  + '=' + staticParameters[key]);
		
		if ( !replaced ) { // do not define the same mbox twice, this leads to additional JS calls
			callFunction.apply(undefined, callParameters);
		}
		
		
		
		if ( callFunction == mboxDefine ) {
		    
		    // if the campaign store is available at this time we are most likely simulating
		    // so trigger an update if the (auto) campaign is selected
            var campaignStore = ClientContext.get("campaign");
            if ( campaignStore && !campaignStore.isCampaignSelected() ) {
                CQ_Analytics.TestTarget.triggerUpdate();
            }
    		
    		// wait for 2 seconds for the T&T answer to come in to prevent page flicker issues
    		// also see the overlay of mbox.protoype.setOffer which completes this
    		setTimeout(function() {
    		    CQ_Analytics.TestTarget.showDefaultMboxContent(mboxId, mboxName);
    		}, 2000);
		}
	}
	
	
		
</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Affordable transportation</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Montreal is a compact city made for people. Unlike many North American cities, you don't need a car. You can move around cheaply and easily on <b>foot,</b>&nbsp;<b>bike, </b><b>bus</b>&nbsp;and <b>metro. </b>Plus, Concordia students get an added benefit: a&nbsp;<b>free shuttle bus service</b>&nbsp;that runs between our two campuses.&nbsp;</p>
<h3>Concordia Shuttle Bus</h3>
<ul>
<li>Provides transportation for students, faculty and staff from campus to campus. The buses stop in front of the Hall Building at the downtown campus (SGW) and in front of the Loyola Chapel.</li>
<li>The ride takes approximately 20 minutes and beats public transportation any day and it's <b>free.</b></li>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="/maps/shuttle-bus.html">Check shuttle bus times</a><b>.</b></li>
</ul>
<h3>Bus or metro</h3>
<p>The public transit system, run by the <b><a href="http://www.stm.info/" target="_blank" adhocenable="false">SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al</a>, </b>will get you anywhere in the city for an affordable price.</p>
<ul>
<li>The Metro is the easiest way to get around Montreal with 4 lines - 68 stations. It will take you pretty much anywhere you want to go in Montreal.</li>
<li>It connects with the rest of the public transport system - bus, commuter train services and even the main national buses and train stations.</li>
<li>Full-time students 18-25 can take advantage of a <b><a adhocenable="false" href="/students/birks/opus-transit-card.html">reduced monthly fare</a>.</b></li>
</ul>
<h3>Bike</h3>
<p>Montreal often rated the <a adhocenable="false" href="http://copenhagenize.eu/index/14.html" target="_blank">most bike-friendly city</a> in North America. There are over 660 km of well-maintained&nbsp;<a href="http://www.velo.qc.ca/documents/reseau_mtl_mai2010.pdf" target="_blank" adhocenable="false">bike paths</a>&nbsp;on the island. Many streets have reserved bike lanes making it safe for cyclists. Just make sure you have a helmet and a good lock!</p>
<ul>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="http://sustainable.concordia.ca/working-groups/allego-concordia/resources/bike/">Visit AllÃ©go Concordia</a> to find good tips on biking in the city.&nbsp;</li>
</ul>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h3>BIXI</h3>
<p>With BIXI, Montreal's popular public bike system, you don't even need to own a bike! Created for short trips, it's an economical form of city travel with stations set up across the city.&nbsp;</p>
<ul>
<li>Accessible to everyone 24/7 from May to November</li>
<li>Over 400 stations, many located in the downtown core, near bike paths making it hugely popular</li>
<li>Easy to use, pick up a BIXI at any station and drop it off once you reach your destination</li>
<li>For more information visit the <a href="http://montreal.bixi.com/home" target="_blank" adhocenable="false">BIXI website</a></li>
</ul>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<div class="parbase image section"><div id="cq-image-jsp-/content/concordia/en/campus-life/off-campus-housing/jcr:content/content-main/image"><img title="off-campus-housing" alt="off-campus-housing" class="cq-dd-image" src="/campus-life/off-campus-housing/_jcr_content/content-main/image.img.jpg/1375550173389.jpg"></div>

<div class="rte">
<p>The Concordia Student Union's&nbsp;<a href="http://hojo.csu.qc.ca/">Off-Campus Housing and Job Bank</a>&nbsp;(HoJo) is your reliable source for apartment searches. You must prove you are an undergraduate student to have full access to the website. On HoJo you can find a variety of resources to help you with off-campus apartment hunting:</p>
<ul>
<li>Legal information, handouts and referral (not advice)</li>
<li>Workshops on your rights as a tenant and worker</li>
<li>A place to conduct your job/housing search (free phone, internet, newspaper classifieds, maps)</li>
<li>Roommate conflict prevention (tips, accounting software, etc.)</li>
<li>Safety resources (apartment checklist, workshops, etc.)</li>
<li>Online Classified ads: (jobs, internships, volunteer positions, roommate profiles, books/furniture for sale)<br>
&nbsp;</li>
</ul>
<h4>Apartment hunting tips</h4>
<ul>
<li>Find out if major appliances are included, such as refrigerator and stove, or if you will have to find your own.</li>
<li>Apartment sizes come in the following: a 1Â½ is a large room with kitchenette and bathroom; a 2Â½ is larger, or has a double room or is L-shaped; a 3Â½ has a separate bedroom, living room, kitchen and bathroom; a 4Â½ has two bedrooms, a living room, kitchen and bathroom; a 5Â½ usually has three bedrooms, and so on.</li>
<li>Find out whether heating is included. If not, plan for winter costs.</li>
</ul>

</div></div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Budgeting</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Being a student means you will likely have very little money, a whole lot of expenses, and a bunch of pressure to get great grades. Besides your studies, <b>keeping on top of money</b> will be one of your biggest challenges.</p>
<p>In short: youâre going to have to<b> learn how to live on a budget</b>! Sound boring? It doesnât have to be â but it is an essential part of succeeding at university. Why? Most of the cash you will spend is going to be borrowed money. Eventually, that borrowed money will have to be paid back.</p>
<p>Budgeting will help you be better prepared to pursue your goals.&nbsp;</p>
<h3>Making a budget is not as hard as you may think it is. &nbsp;</h3>
<p>A budget is basically an <b>itemized summary</b> of likely <b>income </b>and <b>expenses </b>for a given period of time. Budgets help you determine whether you can buy that afternoon Venti Latte or head home and make your own instead. &nbsp;</p>
<p>A budget provides you with a tangible, organized, and easily understood analysis of how much money you have coming in and going out. Itâs an invaluable tool to help you prioritize your spending and manage your moneyâno matter how much or how little you have.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>

</div></div>
<div class="title section">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h2 class="section-header ">Get started: plan your budget</h2>
</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Let's start this process by organizing your money management into a few helpful steps.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase button section">








<a style="margin-bottom:10px;" class="btn  " href="/students/financial-support/budgeting/basic-steps-to-makingabudget.html" target="_self">Learn the basic steps to making a budget</a>

</div>


</div>

            </div>

                <div class="parsys sidebar">

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Returning students</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="title section">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h2>Returning as an undergraduate after an absence</h2>
</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>If you are a former student who wishes to return to Concordia, but you have been absent for a significant period of time, we may require you to submit a new admissions application.</p>
<p>Regardless of your situation, we advise you to <a></a><a adhocenable="false" href="/offices/registrar.html">contact the Office of the Registrar</a>&nbsp;for information on the correct procedure for a returning student. &nbsp;</p>
<h3><span style="font-size: 18px;">Considerations related to returning as a student to Concordia</span></h3>
<p><br>
If you were a Concordia student who wishes to return to study after:</p>
<ul>
<li>An <b>absence of more than 12 months</b>, you may also have to resubmit proof of legal status in Canada and Quebec Resident status</li>
<li><b>Attending another institution</b> and attempting <b>at least 12 credits</b> during your absence from Concordia, then you must submit a new application and make arrangements to have an <b>official transcript</b> sent to the Admissions Application Centre. We assess advanced standing as part of the admissions process. If you attempted <b>fewer than 12 credits</b> or if your attendance at another institution was based exclusively on a <b>letter of prior approval</b> from the Faculty Student Request Committee, a new application is normally not be required. You may, however, be eligible for transfer credits for the work you completed during your absence.</li>
<li><b>You officially withdrew from Concordia University</b> then you must submit a new application. If you attended another institution during your absence, you must also make arrangements to have an official transcript sent to the Office of the Registrar. Advanced standing will be assessed as part of the admissions process.</li>
</ul>
<p>Returning will also depend on the Faculty you studied in as a Concordia student.</p>
<ul>
<li><b>Faculty of Arts and Science: </b>If you have been absent from a program for <b>nine consecutive terms</b> or more, then you will be withdrawn from the program and must meet with an academic advisor before reinstatement into the program.</li>
<li><b>John Molson School of Business: </b>If you have been absent from a program for <b>six consecutive terms</b> or more, then you will be withdrawn from the program and must meet with an academic advisor before reinstatement into the program.</li>
<li><b>Faculty of Engineering and Computer Science: </b>If you have been absent from a program for <b>six consecutive terms</b> or more, then you will be withdrawn from the program and must submit a new application for admission through the Admissions Application Centre.</li>
<li><b>Faculty of Fine Arts: </b>If you have lapsed in a program of study for <b>nine consecutive terms</b> or more, then you will be withdrawn from the program and must meet with an academic advisor before reinstatement into the program.</li>
<li><b>School of Extended Learning: </b>If you<b> </b>have been absent from their program for nine consecutive terms or more, then you will be withdrawn from the program and must meet with an advisor in the Student Transition Centre before reinstatement into the program.</li>
</ul>
<p>The Office of the Registrar or the respective Faculty <b>assesses all requests for pro-tanto credits</b>. Further detailed information is <a></a><a adhocenable="false" href="/admissions/undergraduate/requirements-transfer-students.html">available in the section on Transfer Students</a>&nbsp;or in the <a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current.html">Undergraduate Calendar</a>.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase secondary-navigation section">







<div class="c-sidebar-menu c-secondary-navigation" id="secondary_navigation">

</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<h1>Independent students</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="title section">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h2>Take courses on a part-time basis</h2>
</div></div>
<div class="section tabs">










    <script type="text/javascript">
	$ = jQuery;
	$(document).ready(function() {
	    $('#tabs a:first').tab('show');
	    var hash = window.location.hash;
	    if (hash == undefined || hash == ""){
	      var previouslyActive = getCookie("concordia-component-tab-active-tab");
          if (previouslyActive != undefined) hash = previouslyActive;
	    }
	    hash && $('ul.nav a[href="' + hash + '"]').tab('show');

	    $('.nav-tabs a').click(function (e) {
	        $(this).tab('show');
	        var scrollmem = $('body').scrollTop();
	        window.location.hash = this.hash;
	        $('html,body').scrollTop(scrollmem);
	        setCookie("concordia-component-tab-active-tab", this.hash, 1);
	    });
	});
        /** COOKIE GETTER AND SETTER FUNCTIONS **/
    function setCookie(c_name,value,exdays){
        var exdate=new Date();
        exdate.setDate(exdate.getDate() + exdays);
        var c_value=escape(value) + ((exdays==null) ? "" : "; expires="+exdate.toUTCString());
        document.cookie=c_name + "=" + c_value;
    }
    function getCookie(c_name){
      var c_value=document.cookie;
      var c_start=c_value.indexOf(" " + c_name + "=");
      if (c_start == -1)	{
        c_start=c_value.indexOf(c_name + "=");
      }
      if (c_start == -1){
        c_value=null;
      } else {
        c_start=c_value.indexOf("=", c_start) + 1;
        var c_end=c_value.indexOf(";", c_start);
        if (c_end == -1){
          c_end=c_value.length;
        }
        c_value=unescape(c_value.substring(c_start,c_end));
      }
      return c_value;
    }
	</script>

	        <div class="tab-pane" id="tab0">
	           
	           <div class="parsys parsys-tabs-0">


<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">

</div></div>
<div class="parbase box section">









<div class="c-sidebar-calltoaction bloc link-color-dark " style="background-color: #C8C8C8 !important;  color: # !important;   ">


    <h2 class="section-header" style='color: # !important; '></h2>
    <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<table border="0" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="10">
<tbody><tr><td>We strongly encourage you to submit a complete Undergraduate Independent Student Application by <b>Monday, December 9, 2013</b> if you plan to register for courses in Winter 2014. We cannot guarantee that applications received after that date will be processed in time for you to begin this winter session. A complete application means that in addition to the application form you have submitted all of the documents required for your file to be assessed.</td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div></div>


</div>



</div>

</div>
<div class="parbase section reference"><div style="display:inline;" class="cq-dd-paragraph"><div class="parbase wysiwyg">



<div class="rte">
<p><span style="font-size: 12.222222328186035px;">As an independent undergraduate student, you do not seek a Degree or Certificate. You register in individual courses on a part-time basis.</span></p>
<p>You can apply to become an independent undergraduate student if:</p>
<ul>
<li>You are <b>over 21 years of age</b> and are Canadian or a Permanent Resident</li>
</ul>
<p><i>or</i></p>
<ul>
<li>You are <b>under 21 years of age</b> and you meet the Universityâs minimum academic admission requirements&nbsp;</li>
<li><b>You are an International student already in Montreal. </b>International independent student status is not intended for foreigners applying from abroad because <b>this status may not enable you</b> to obtain the required Study Permit and CAQ to study in Canada.<br>
&nbsp;</li>
</ul>
<h3>Admission requirements and course registration</h3>
<p>All independent students must satisfy <a adhocenable="false" href="/admissions/undergraduate/requirements-canada.html">minimum admission requirements</a>. Independent student status in no way guarantees you a place in a course.</p>
<p>When registering for a course, independent students may register:</p>
<ul>
<li>For a <b>maximum of 9 credits per term&nbsp;</b></li>
<li>For a course after all undergraduate degree program students have had a chance to select their courses.</li>
</ul>
<p><b>Courses with prerequisites: </b>Independent students must satisfy the University that they have completed all required prerequisite courses. In these cases, you must complete a &quot;Prerequisite Waiver&quot; form.</p>
<ul>
<li>Find out more about <a adhocenable="false" href="/admissions/independent-students/points.html">independent student course registration<br>
 &nbsp;</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>Applying to a program</h3>
<p>You should apply online through the <a adhocenable="false" href="https://www.myconcordia.ca/">MyConcordia portal</a> if you are an independent student who subsequently wishes to enter a degree or certificate program. Any credits you earned as an independent student might be applied towards a degree or Certificate program, if they are appropriate.</p>
<p>How many credits you receive will depend on the program and the Faculty. For instance, in the case of the Faculty of Arts and Science, an independent student may be granted a <b>maximum of 30 credits</b> towards their degree.<br>
&nbsp;</p>
<h3>Apply to be an independent student</h3>
<p>If you wish to become an undergraduate Independent student at Concordia, you must <a adhocenable="false" href="http://sims.concordia.ca/independent/" target="_blank">complete an Independent Student Application form online</a>.</p>
<ul>
<li>The completed online form must include all relevant supporting documents&nbsp;</li>
<li>There is a $15 application fee payable by credit card (Visa, Mastercard or American Express)<ul>
<li>&nbsp;This fee is subject to change<br>
&nbsp;</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>For more information on admission and supporting documents, please <a adhocenable="false" href="/admissions/independent-students/criteria.html">consult the undergraduate Independent Students' Information Guide</a>.<br>
&nbsp;</li>
</ul>
<h3>Academic advising for Independent Undergraduate Students</h3>
<p><b>Student Transition Centre</b></p>
<p>Newly-admitted Independent students are <b>strongly encouraged to contact the <a adhocenable="false" href="/extended-learning/advising.html">Student Transition Centre</a><i> </i></b>in order to obtain advising prior to commencing their studies. Appointments with an advisor are given in person or by phone only.</p>
<p>E-mail: <a href="mailto:stc@alcor.concordia.ca">stc@alcor.concordia.ca</a><br>
Tel: 514-848-2424 ext. 3891<br>
Fax: 514-848-3442<br>
Website: <a adhocenable="false" href="/extended-learning/advising.html">Student Transition Centre</a></p>
<p><b>Birks Student Service Centre</b><br>
</p>
<p>Concordia University<br>
Room LB-185, J.W. McConnell<br>
1400 De Maisonneuve Blvd. West<br>
Montreal, Quebec</p>
<p>Tel: 514-848-2424 ext. 2668</p>
<p>Monday to Thursday: 10 a.m. - 7 p.m.<br>
Friday: 9 a.m. - 6 p.m.</p>

</div></div>
</div>
</div>


</div>

	        </div>
	        <div class="tab-pane" id="tab1">
	           
	           <div class="parsys parsys-tabs-1">


<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase section reference"><div style="display:inline;" class="cq-dd-paragraph"><div class="parbase wysiwyg">



<div class="rte">
<p><a name="graduate"></a>Independent graduate students enrol in a particular graduate course, without enroling in the graduate program which offers the course. Normally, independent graduate students take no more than the equivalent of two graduate courses per term, and no more than the equivalent of four graduate courses from the courses of any graduate program up to 12 credits. Independent students are normally classified as graduate part-time students.</p>
<p>Only those who meet the prerequisite requirements for admission to the graduate course in question will be considered as independent graduate students, and in every case permission of the Graduate Program Director and/or Faculty Student Affairs Office must be obtained. Meeting the minimum requirements of an individual course does not guarantee entry to that course, as preference will be given to regular students.</p>
<p>Independent graduate students are subject to the fees and regulations applicable to such categories of students.</p>
<p>Complete information on Independent Graduate Students can be found in the&nbsp;<a href="/academics/graduate/calendar/current/graduate-admission.html" adhocenable="false">Graduate Admission section</a>&nbsp;of the Graduate Calendar.</p>
<h3>Authorization to Register as a Non-degree Student</h3>
<p>To register as an independent graduate student, the applicant must complete the graduate â<a adhocenable="false" href="/content/dam/concordia/offices/sgs/docs/forms/independentregistration.pdf">Authorization to Register as a Non-Degree Student</a>â? [PDF] form.</p>
<p>Applicants must submit the completed form to the Graduate Program Assistant of the graduate program which is offering the course. They must also submit a copy of their most recent transcript (student copies are acceptable; normally, copies downloaded from the web are not).&nbsp;&nbsp;<a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/graduate/program-contacts.html">View a list of Graduate Program Contacts</a>.</p>
<h3>Courses</h3>
<p>A list of courses offered by the graduate program is available in the&nbsp;<a href="/academics/graduate/calendar/current.html" adhocenable="false">Graduate Calendar</a>. You can access a list, along with brief course descriptions by selecting the graduate program which offers the course. Applicants should know, or have an idea, of which course they want to take.</p>
<h3>Proof of Citizenship and Proof of Legal Name</h3>
<p>Applicants must also provide proof of citizenship status and proof of legal name. While the Canadian passport can be used to prove citizenship status, an additional document must be provided for proof of legal name.&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="/content/dam/concordia/offices/registrar/docs/NamesGuide.pdf" adhocenable="false">View a list of documents</a>&nbsp;[PDF] which can be used as proof for both citizenship status and proof of legal name.</p>
<h3>Proof of QuÃ©bec Residency</h3>
<p>As per the Ministry of Education, students who are not QuÃ©bec residents are charged a higher tuition rate than QuÃ©bec Residents. To avoid the higher rate, all Canadian Citizens (including First Nations) and Permanent Residents must submit the required documents by the deadline. Visit the&nbsp;<a href="/admissions/tuition-fees/quebec-residency.html" adhocenable="false">QuÃ©bec Residency website</a>&nbsp;for deadlines and additional information.</p>
<h3>Code Permanent</h3>
<p>As per the Ministry of Education, all students are required to have a permanent code in order to study in QuÃ©bec. Students who do not have a permanent code will be charged an additional fee for their courses. To avoid the additional charge, applicants must make the necessary arrangements to obtain a permanent code. Visit the&nbsp;<a href="/admissions/tuition-fees/permanent-code.html" adhocenable="false">Permanent Code page</a>&nbsp;for more information.</p>
<h3>Permission to Register</h3>
<p>Upon receipt of all the required documents, the Graduate Program Director will evaluate the applicantâs academic credentials to determine if the applicant is qualified to take the graduate courses. In some departments, the applicant must also get permission from the professor teaching the course. If the applicant is recommended, the Graduate Program Assistant will forward the applicantâs file to the Faculty Student Affairs Office for final approval. Upon final approval, the Faculty will forward the file to the Office of the Registrar to create the Independent Graduate status for the applicant. Once the applicant has received Independent Graduate status, the Graduate Assistant can register the applicant in courses.</p>
<p>As the entire procedure may take 2 or more weeks, applicants are advised to start procedures well ahead of the registration deadline. Applicants are reminded that independent graduate students register after students enroled in a degree and are not guaranteed a place in a course.</p>
<h3>Advising for Independent Graduate Students</h3>
<p>For advice on Graduate Independent Studies please contact the Program&nbsp;Assistant of the graduate program which is offering the course.&nbsp;<a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/graduate/program-contacts.html">View a list of Graduate Program Contacts</a>.</p>

</div></div>
</div>
</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>
