<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>We are located in the Guy Metro (GM) Building at the Sir George Williams campus and in the AD Building at the Loyola campus.</p>
<h3><b>Sir George Williams Campus</b></h3>
<p>Government Student Assistance Programs, Undergraduate Scholarships, Bursaries and Awards and Work-Study Program</p>
<p>Suite GM-230.00<br>
1550 Boulevard de Maisonneuve West, Montreal, Quebec, Metro Guy-Concordia</p>
<h4>Hours</h4>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h3>By Appointment Services</h3>
<p>Please note that students are able to make appointments to see advisors for government loan eligibility requirements and procedures, help with planning a budget as well as any other loan related assistance. For the summer session appointments will be available between 9:00 a.m. and 12:00 p.m. on Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and from 10:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. on Wednesday. Walk in service remains available from 1:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. Monday to Thursday and Friday from 9:00 to 1:00.<br>
<br>
As always, students can obtain general information, pick up forms and complete many other routine transactions at our main service counter which remains open from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. every day except Wednesday when the hours are from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Friday from 9:00a.m. to 1:00 p.m. until Aug. 16,2013.<br>
<br>
To book an appointment please call us at 514-848-2424 X 3507 or visit our GM 230 office. We look forward to seeing you.</p>

</div></div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<H1>Contacts</H1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h3>Telephone</h3>
<p>Main telephone line: (514) 848-2424 <b>extension 3507</b></p>
<p>Please note:</p>
<ul>
<li>Our main telephone line (3507) is <b>in significant demand</b>. Before you call, please consult the <a adhocenable="false" href="/students/financial-support.html">Financial Matters</a>&nbsp;pages for students to see if answers to your questions are already available online.</li>
<li>Due to confidentiality, the specific amount, availability, or the disbursement of your governmental student assistance is not disclosed by telephone.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Email</h3>
<ul>
<li>General student inquiries: <a adhocenable="false" href="mailto:help@faao.concordia.ca">help@faao.concordia.ca</a></li>
<li>Work-Study student inquiries: <a adhocenable="false" href="mailto:workstudy@faao.concordia.ca">workstudy@faao.concordia.ca</a></li>
<li>Student inquiries about Undergraduate Awards: <a adhocenable="false" href="mailto:help@faao.concordia.ca">help@faao.concordia.ca<br>
 &nbsp;</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>Mailing address</h3>
<p>Financial Aid and Awards office<br>
1455 de Maisonneuve Blvd, W<br>
Room GM-230<br>
Montreal, Quebec<br>
H3G 1M8</p>
<h3>Fax</h3>
<p>Fax line for governmental student assistance: (514) 848-3508&nbsp;</p>
<p>Fax line for Undergraduate Awards and Work Study: (514) 848-2589</p>
<h3>In person</h3>
<p>To obtain an updated confirmation of enrollment for your governmental student aid, you must visit our office in person. <a adhocenable="false" href="/offices/5748475904021/location-and-hours.html">Check our location and hours page</a> for full details.</p>
<p>We are located at:&nbsp;</p>
<p>Financial Aid and Awards office<br>
1550 de Maisonneuve Blvd, Guy-Metro (GM) Building,<br>
Room GM-230<br>
Montreal, Quebec<br>
H3G 1N2</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Government plans</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Life Insurance benefits are also provided under certain government plans, subject to eligibility requirements.</p>
<p>Under the <a target="_blank" href="http://www.hrsdc.gc.ca/eng/oas-cpp/index.shtml">Canada</a> or <a target="_blank" href="http://www.rrq.gouv.qc.ca/en/accueil/Pages/accueil.aspx">Quebec Pension Plans</a> (C/QPP), a lump-sum death benefit may be payable to your surviving spouse or estate. In addition, your surviving spouse and dependent children may be entitled to a monthly pension for survivors.</p>
<p>If your death is due to an automobile accident, the <a target="_blank" href="http://www.saaq.gouv.qc.ca/">SociÃ©tÃ© de lâassurance automobile du QuÃ©bec</a> may pay a lump-sum benefit, and your surviving <a href="/hr/glossary.html#spouse" adhocenable="false">spouse</a> and <a href="/hr/glossary.html#dependent-children" adhocenable="false">dependent children</a> may receive a pension based on your earnings at the time of the accident and the number of your dependents.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase secondary-navigation section">







<div class="c-sidebar-menu c-secondary-navigation" id="secondary_navigation">

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Conversion privileges</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>When your employment terminates, you have 90 days to convert your coverage to an individual policy, up to the same amount.</p>
<p>To do so, simply apply at any office of <a target="_blank" href="http://www.chartisinsurance.com/home_922_210111.html">Chartis</a>.</p>
<p>Your new policy will then be effective once the insurance company receives your application or, if later, when coverage under this current policy ends.</p>
<p>Your premium will be based on the insurer's normal premiums for individual or family policies, <b>not</b> the premiums charged under this group policy.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase secondary-navigation section">

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Pension plan</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>The Pension Plan for the Employees of Concordia University is a worry-free way to save for retirement. It provides benefits that are defined ahead of time based on a set formula using your <a href="/hr/glossary.html#pensionable-earnings" adhocenable="false">pensionable earnings</a> and years of <a href="/hr/glossary.html#credited-service" adhocenable="false">credited service</a>.</p>
<p>As a result, your benefits are guaranteed and protected, regardless of economic or market conditions. Investment returns do not affect your defined benefits. The university is responsible for ensuring that the plan is sufficiently funded to provide the pension benefits that you earn under the plan.</p>
<p>You automatically participate as a non-contributory member. This means you build retirement income under the plan without having to pay a cent!</p>
<p>Or you may wish to be a contributory member. Why? You increase your benefits from the plan and your contributions are tax deductible.</p>
<p><b>This section describes the Pension Plan for the Employees of Concordia University for members who are currently employed by the University. If you are not currently employed by the University, please contact <a href="mailto:pensions@concordia.ca">Pension Services</a> for details.</b></p>
<p>As good as the plan may be, other sources of income are also essential to a comfortable retirement. Consult the retirement planning section on the intranet (Cspace) for details.</p>
<p>You should seek the advice of a retirement, financial or tax specialist for help in your financial planning for retirement or in evaluating your current situation.</p>
<h3>Eligibility and enrolment</h3>

</div></div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        <a name="who-is-eligible"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Who is eligible">
					
                    Who is eligible
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase table section">




<div class="concordia-table   smallText table-condensed horizontalLines verticalLines table-striped">
    <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><th valign="top" colspan="2">You are eligible to participate in the Pension Plan for the Employees of Concordia University if you are:</th>
</tr><tr><td valign="top"><ul>
<li>a full-time, permanent employee; or</li>
</ul>
</td>
<td valign="top">&nbsp;</td>
</tr><tr><td valign="top"><ul>
<li>not a full-time, permanent employee but you have met one of the following qualifications in the previous calendar year:</li>
</ul>
</td>
<td valign="top"><ul>
<li>a minimum of 700 hours worked; or</li>
<li>remuneration equal to at least 35% of the YMPE.</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        <a name="when-to-enrol"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open When to enrol">
					
                    When to enrol
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_0" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase table section">




<div class="concordia-table   smallText table-condensed horizontalLines verticalLines table-striped">
    <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><th>If you are a...</th>
<th>You...</th>
</tr><tr><td>Full-time, permanent employee</td>
<td>Automatically join the Pension Plan for the Employees of Concordia University as of your date of employment.</td>
</tr><tr><td>Not a full-time, permanent employee</td>
<td><p>Join the plan on January 1 of the year following the calendar year in which you meet one of the following qualifications:</p>
<ul>
<li>a minimum of 700 hours worked; or</li>
<li>remuneration equal to at least 35% of the <a adhocenable="false" href="/hr/glossary.html#YMPE">YMPE</a>.</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div></div>

                <div class="parsys sidebar">

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Group RSP</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>The Concordia Group Retirement Savings Plan (RSP) is a great complement to the Pension Plan! You can count on:</p>
<ul>
<li>control over how your contributions are invested;</li>
<li>the convenience of payroll deductions;</li>
<li>tax savings as you make your deposits;</li>
<li>no minimum contribution required to invest in any of the funds in the program;</li>
<li>low investment management fees;</li>
<li>no front-end loads and no back-end loads;</li>
<li>enhanced interest rates for guaranteed interest accounts;</li>
<li>the freedom to change your investment instructions for future deposits and existing assets as often as you need, at no extra cost;</li>
<li>education sessions conducted by Canada Life representatives;</li>
<li>courteous, helpful reps at Canada Life's Customer Care Centre;</li>
<li>easy access to your account via VIP Line and <a href="https://vipnet.canadalife.ca" target="_blank">VIP Net</a>;</li>
<li>informative statements provided every 6 months;</li>
<li>the possibility of transferring your personal RRSP to the Concordia Group RSP; and</li>
<li>unlike RRSPs offered by other financial institutions, your Concordia Group RSP could be safe from creditors in the event you declare bankruptcy.</li>
</ul>
<p>So take your retirement savings to the limit today! For assistance, we encourage you to seek the advice of a retirement, financial or tax specialist for help in your financial planning for retirement or in evaluating your current situation.</p>
<h3>Highlights</h3>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase table section">




<div class="concordia-table   smallText table-condensed horizontalLines verticalLines table-striped">
    <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">

<td valign="top"><ul>
<li>Payroll deductions</li>
<li>Lump-sum deposit</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr><tr><td valign="top"><b>Investment options</b></td>
<td valign="top"><ul>
<li>Guaranteed Interest Accounts</li>
<li>Money Market Funds</li>
<li>Bond Funds</li>
<li>Balanced Funds</li>
<li>Canadian Equity Funds</li>
<li>U.S. Equity Funds</li>
<li>Global Equity Funds</li>
<li>International Equity Funds</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr><tr><td valign="top"><b>Changes</b><br>
(in contribution level, investment options, etc.)</td>
<td valign="top">At any time</td>
</tr><tr><td valign="top"><b>Plan administrator</b></td>
<td valign="top"><a target="_blank" href="http://www.canadalife.ca" adhocenable="false">Canada Life</a></td>
</tr></tbody></table>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Life insurance plans</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>The Concordia Life Insurance Plans are designed to provide a financial safety net in the event of your death or that of a covered dependent.</p>
<p>You decide on the size of your safety net:</p>
<ul>
<li>You want minimal coverage for yourself?<br>
You have the Basic Life Insurance Plan, which is fully paid for by the University.</li>
<li>You want extra coverage for yourself?<br>
Buy additional coverage at competitive group rates under the Optional Life Insurance Plan. This plan pays benefits in addition to the Basic Life Insurance Plan. You pay for the full cost.</li>
<li>You want to cover your spouse and/or dependent children?<br>
Buy coverageâalso at competitive group ratesâunder the Optional Dependent Life Insurance Plan. You pay for the full cost.</li>
</ul>
<p>The choice is yours!</p>
<h3>Highlights</h3>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase table section">




<div class="concordia-table   smallText table-condensed horizontalLines verticalLines table-striped">
    <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><th colspan="4">Current coverage</th>
</tr><tr><td valign="top"><b>For you</b></td>
<td valign="top"><b>Basic Life Insurance Plan</b></td>
<td valign="top"><b>&nbsp;</b></td>
<td valign="top"><b>Optional Life Insurance Plan</b></td>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">Coverage</td>
<td valign="top">1 x your <a href="/hr/glossary.html#annual-base-salary" adhocenable="false">annual base salary</a></td>
<td>&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="top">1, 2, 3 or 4 x your annual base salary</td>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">Maximum benefits<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
</td>
<td valign="top">$200,000</td>
<th style="text-align: center;"><p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><b>PLUS</b></p>
</th>
<td valign="top">$200,000 for optional coverage<br>
of 1 x your annual base salary<br>
<br>
$400,000 for optional coverage<br>
of 2 x your annual base salary<br>
<br>
$600,000 for optional coverage<br>
of 3 x your annual base salary<br>
<br>
$800,000 for optional coverage<br>
of 4 x your annual base salary</td>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">Cost</td>

<div class="parbase table section">




<div class="concordia-table   smallText table-condensed horizontalLines verticalLines table-striped">
    <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><th valign="top">For your eligible dependents</th>
<th valign="top">Optional Life Insurance Plan - Coverage</th>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">Your <a href="/hr/glossary.html#spouse" adhocenable="false">spouse</a></td>
<td valign="top">$10,000 to $100,000 (in units of $10,000)</td>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">Each <a href="/hr/glossary.html#dependent-children" adhocenable="false">dependent child</a></td>
<td valign="top">$2,500 to $25,000 (in units of $2,500)</td>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">If you cover both your spouse AND dependent children</td>
<td valign="top">Note: for each $10,000 of coverage you buy for your spouse, each of your dependent children is automatically covered for $2,500</td>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">Cost</td>
<td valign="top">You pay 100% of the cost</td>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>The Concordia University Optional Accident Insurance Plan - also known as the Optional Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance Plan - allows you to purchase financial protection in the event of your accidental death or that of a covered family member. These benefits are payable in addition to any other life insurance plan benefits.</p>
<p>This Optional Accident Insurance Plan also pays benefits should you or a covered family member suffer an accidental injury.</p>
<p>This coverage is in force 24 hours a day, anywhere in the world, on or off the job. You have the flexibility of covering yourself only or both yourself and your family.</p>
<h3>Highlights</h3>
<p><b>If you elect coverage under this plan, you have 2 options:</b></p>
<ol>
<li>Coverage for yourself only</li>
<li>Coverage for both yourself and your family</li>
</ol>
<p><b>The benefits payable, subject to certain conditions, are:</b></p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase table section">




<div class="concordia-table   smallText table-condensed horizontalLines verticalLines">
    <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><th valign="top" colspan="3">In the event of accidental death</th>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">Coverage for you</td>
<td valign="top">&nbsp;</td>
<td>Up to $750,000<br>
(in units of $10,000)</td>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">Coverage for you and your family</td>
<td valign="top">For you:</td>
<td>Up to $750,000<br>
(in units of $10,000)</td>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">&nbsp;</td>
<th valign="top" colspan="2">For your <a adhocenable="false" href="/hr/glossary.html#eligible-dependents">eligible dependents</a>:</th>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">&nbsp;</td>
<th valign="top" colspan="2">Your <a adhocenable="false" href="/hr/glossary.html#spouse">spouse</a>:</th>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="top">If you have dependent children</td>
<td>50% of your coverage for accidental death</td>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="top">If you do not have dependent children</td>
<td>60% of your coverage for accidental death</td>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">&nbsp;</td>
<th valign="top" colspan="2">Each <a adhocenable="false" href="/hr/glossary.html#dependent-children">dependent child</a>:</th>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="top">If you have a spouse</td>
<td>15% of your coverage for accidental death</td>
</tr><tr><td valign="top">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="top">If you do not have a spouse</td>
<td>20% of your coverage for accidental death</td>
</tr><tr><th valign="top" colspan="3">In the event of accidental injury</th>
</tr><tr><td valign="top" colspan="3">For each covered <a adhocenable="false" href="/hr/glossary.html#accidental-injury">injury</a>, the plan pays a percentage of the amount payable for accidental death.</td>
</tr><tr><th valign="top" colspan="3">Other Benefits</th>
</tr><tr><td valign="top" colspan="3"><ul>
<li>Seat-belt benefits</li>
<li>Felonious assault</li>
<li>Common disaster</li>
<li>Child enhancement</li>
<li>Rehabilitation</li>
<li>Repatriation</li>
<li>Family transportation</li>
<li>Education</li>
<li>Home and vehicle alterations</li>
<li>Identification</li>
<li>Funeral expenses</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase box section">









<div class="c-sidebar-calltoaction bloc link-color-dark with-border" style="padding:20px; color: # !important;   ">


    <h2 class="section-header" style='color: # !important; '></h2>
    <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><img style="float: right;" src="/content/dam/concordia/services/hr/images/postcard-stamp.gif"></p>
<p>Except in the case of paralysis or as described under the Other Benefits section on the intranet (Cspace), the benefits payable for all losses resulting from any one accident cannot exceed the amount payable for accidental death.</p>

</div></div>


</div>



</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Workshops &amp; courses</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase box section">









<div class="c-sidebar-calltoaction bloc link-color-dark with-border" style="padding:20px color: # !important;   ">


    <h2 class="section-header" style='color: # !important; '>How to enrol</h2>
    <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<ul>
<li>Login to <a href="https://www.myconcordia.ca/">MyConcordia</a></li>
<li>Select &quot;Employee Self-Service&quot; and then &quot;My HR Profile&quot; from the menu</li>
<li>From &quot;my empath&quot; menu, select &quot;training&quot; and then &quot;enrol in a class&quot;</li>
</ul>
<p>Please note that course enrolments require supervisor approval. While all workshops/courses are offered at no cost for employees, space is limited and on a first come, first served basis! Cancellation fees may apply when cancelled within (10) business days of the course.</p>
<p>For questions, comments or suggestions, please contact us at <b><a href="mailto:training@concordia.ca">training@concordia.ca</a>.</b></p>

</div></div>


</div>



</div>

</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h3>Cancellation policy</h3>
<p>Concordia University is committed to advancing the capabilities of its employees. As such, the university offers workshops and courses at no cost to participants. However, space is limited. In order to ensure that valuable resources are used efficiently, a cancellation provision may apply.</p>
<h4>Conditions for employees</h4>
<ul>
<li>Employees require their supervisorâs approval to register for workshops or courses.</li>
<li>Employees who withdraw less than 10 business days prior to the date of the workshop or course, or do not attend, are required to reimburse 50% of the cost of the workshop or course, not exceeding $179. (We understand that serious or unforeseen circumstances may prevent employees from attending. In such cases, exceptions may be made.)</li>
<li>The amount will be reimbursed to the university as stipulated in paragraph 18 of policy HR-37. Policy HR-37</li>
<li>Appropriate substitutions can be made at no cost to the employee, upon approval of human resources.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Conditions for managers with employees enrolled in workshops or courses</h4>
<ul>
<li>Employees require their supervisorâs approval to register for workshops or courses.</li>
<li><i>Less than 10 business days prior to the date of the workshop or course</i> â Should it become impossible for a manager to liberate an employee for the workshop or course, the department will be required to reimburse 50% of the cost of the workshop or course, not exceeding $179. (We understand that serious or unforeseen circumstances may prevent the manager from liberating an employee. In such cases, exceptions may be made.)</li>
<li>The amount will be reimbursed to the university as stipulated in paragraph 18 of policy HR-37. Policy HR-37</li>
<li>Appropriate substitutions can be made at no cost to the department, upon approval of human resources.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Learning and Development</h3>
<p>The 2013 Learning and Development calendar is designed to meet the needs of our managers and staff. This new curriculum is the culmination of work carried out since 2009, which included focus groups and surveys that identified our employeesâ professional development requirements.</p>
<h4>New for 2013</h4>
<p>Last year marked the inauguration of a new Leadership Portfolio, a well-rounded program comprised of an initial series of courses that supported an approach to effective leadership skills to maximize the managersâ ability to lead, mentor, develop and mobilize their employees. This year, eight (8) new workshops / courses have been added to the portfolio. Managers can follow as many and as few courses as they choose within the program, depending on their needs and interests.</p>
<p>Also being launched this year is a new line of courses designed for managers and staff where the focus is on improving customer service as well as various administrative skills.</p>
<h3>Back by popular demand</h3>
<p>Other popular workshops / courses from the 2012 curriculum, on topics such as communication skills and stress management have been brought back this year to provide more of our employees the opportunity to benefit from them.</p>
<ul>
<li>Access the <a adhocenable="false" href="/hr/training-development.html">2013 calendar</a>.</li>
</ul>
<p>Employees will also require their supervisorâs approval to register for courses. Should it become impossible for a manager to liberate an employee for a course once they have registered, the department will have to defray the cost of the course, in concordance with the aforementioned terms.</p>
<h3>Additional workshop / course options</h3>
<h4>Employee Assistance Program (EAP)</h4>
<p>The Employee Assistance Program (EAP) periodically offers free seminars addressing a variety of issues in order to help employees attain a better quality of life. For more information regarding EAP upcoming offering(s) and to register, please refer to <a href="http://eap.concordia.ca/seminars.html">EAP</a>.</p>
<h4>Instructional and Information Technology Services (IITS)</h4>
<p>IITS provides a wide selection of free computer workshops to faculty and staff on all University supported software. The majority of the sessions are offered twice a year (Fall and Winter) and span the entire computing spectrum, from PC-based applications to operating systems, the Web and other Internet topics. For more information regarding IITS upcoming offerings and to register, please refer to <a href="/iits/services.html" adhocenable="false">IITS</a>.<br>
</p>
<h4>Security Department / Nonviolent Crisis Intervention training</h4>
<p>The Nonviolent Crisis Intervention program teaches Concordia faculty and staff members to safely respond to difficult behavior and manage crisis situation with confidence.</p>
<ul>
<li>Learn how to take control of an out-of-control situation</li>
<li>Recognize non-verbal behavior</li>
<li>Recognize para-verbal communication</li>
<li>Identify sources of anxiety and fear, and be able to control them</li>
<li>Learn a few safety techniques</li>
</ul>
<p>For more information regarding the Nonviolent Crisis Intervention program upcoming workshops and to register, please refer to <a href="http://security.concordia.ca/prevention/training/">Security</a>.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Policies</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Policies and guidelines are an important part of our culture and our working life at Concordia. They have been created to provide structure and clarity to assist employees in navigating through unclear situations and provide guidance and support to assure positive conclusions.</p>
<p>Awareness and comprehension of Concordia policies benefit both employees and the university, as they provide procedures and measures to ensure clear expectations and outcomes.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        <a name="2013"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Policy awareness campaign in fall 2013">
					
                    Policy awareness campaign in fall 2013
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Concordia policies are being underscored again in 2013 because theyâre an important part of everyday life at Concordia. Theyâre there to make sure Concordians know their rights, and those of the other members of the community. They also outline the steps for resolution and the potential resources available should those rights be violated.</p>
<p>The campaign will run from October 22 to November 13. Weekly stories about policies are posted on <a href="https://cspace.concordia.ca/">Cspace</a>, the Concordia intranet, and promoted in the weekly e-newsletter. These stories included links to the specific policy.</p>
<ul>
<li>October 22 â <a adhocenable="false" href="https://cspace.concordia.ca/services/hr/news/2013/10/22/a-code-to-ive-by.html">A code to live by</a></li>
<li>October 29 â <a adhocenable="false" href="https://cspace.concordia.ca/services/hr/news/2013/10/29/sharpen-the-ines-of-harassment.html">Sharpen the lines of harassment</a></li>
</ul>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        <a name="2012"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Policy awareness campaign in fall 2012">
					
                    Policy awareness campaign in fall 2012
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_0" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h4>September 11, 2012</h4>
<p>To support our employees in better understanding our policies, we launched a policy awareness campaign in fall 2012.</p>
<p>From September 12 to October 26, 2012, weekly policy stories were posted in the news section of Concordia.ca and promoted in the weekly e-newsletter. These stories included links to the specific policy.</p>
<ul>
<li><u><a href="/news/stories/2012/09/12/code-exists-to-protect-not-to-punish.html">Sep 12 -&nbsp;Code exists to protect</a></u></li>
<li><u><a href="/news/stories/2012/09/18/policy-awareness-campaign-highlights-employee-code-of-ethics.html">Sep 18 -&nbsp;Policy awareness campaign highlights employee Code of Ethics</a></u></li>
<li><u><a href="/news/stories/2012/09/25/protecting-personal-information.html">Sep 25 -&nbsp;Protecting personal information</a></u></li>
<li><u><a href="/news/stories/2012/10/02/safety-first.html">Oct 2 -&nbsp;Safety first</a></u></li>
<li><u><a href="/news/stories/2012/10/10/promoting-a-culture-of-safety.html">Oct 10 -&nbsp;Promoting a culture of safety</a></u></li>
<li><u><a href="/news/stories/2012/10/15/shining-a-light-on-harassment.html">Oct 15 -&nbsp;Shining a light on harassment</a></u></li>
<li><u><a href="/news/stories/2012/10/23/signing-on-the-dotted-line.html">Oct 23 -&nbsp;Signing on the dotted line</a></u></li>
<li><u><a href="/news/stories/2012/10/30/understanding-concordia-policies.html" adhocenable="false">Oct 30 -&nbsp;Understanding Concordia policies</a></u></li>
</ul>
<p>Managers were also asked to read seven additional policies that were identified in weekly reminder emails. After the seven-week period, there was a pop-up box when employees logged into the MyConcordia portal, requesting confirmation that the policies had been read. Once confirmed, full access to the portal was granted.</p>
<hr>

<h4>FAQ</h4>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<ol>
<li><b>I have worked at the university for 25 years, why do I have to confirm reading the university policies now?</b></li>
<p>Concordia employees have always been expected to familiarize themselves with the policies that are relevant to them. It is important for all employees to understand the content of the policies to assist them in making the best decisions, particularly in unclear or ambiguous situations. Confirmation that every employee has become familiar with the policies that are most relevant to them is simply a process by which to ensure that everyone has read and understands the policies significant to them.</p>
<li><b>I am a manager with staff, why do I have to read seven additional policies?</b></li>
<p>The additional policies were selected for their relevance to managers. There are policies where a managerâs leadership is important for the safety of employees, such as the policy related to emergency situations.<br>
Additionally, there are policies related to travel, expenses and procurement that are more relevant to managers than to staff.</p>
<li><b>I am a manager with no staff, how many policies do I need to read?</b></li>
<p>You are expected to read the same seven policies that all employees are required to read and any others that would be related to the type of work you do.</p>
<li><b>Does everyone working at the university have to confirm having read the assigned policies?</b></li>
<p>Yes, all employees, current and new are required to confirm that they have read the selected policies on an annual basis.</p>
<li><b>Who do I contact if I do not understand a policy?</b></li>
<p>Employees may speak with their managers or contact the originating office of the policy, which is identified on each policy.</p>
<li><b>What are the seven policies that I need to know as an employee?</b><ul>
<li>Code of rights and responsibilities (BD-3)</li>
<li>Code of Ethics and safe disclosure policy (BD-4)</li>
<li>Policy concerning the protection of personal information (VPIRSG-9)</li>
<li>Environmental health and safety policy (VPS-40)</li>
<li>Security policy (VPS-20)</li>
<li>Policy on harassment, sexual harassment and psychological harassment (HR-38)</li>
<li>Signing authority policy (BD-1)&nbsp;<br>
&nbsp;</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><b>What are the seven additional policies I need to know as a manager?</b><ul>
<li>Emergency evacuation and fire policy (VPS-49)&nbsp;</li>
<li>Policy on working outside the hours of operation or in isolation (VPS-6)</li>
<li>Policy on travel outside of Quebec (VPS-53)</li>
<li>Travel and other allowable expenses policy (VPF-3)</li>
<li>Procurement policy (CFO-20)</li>
<li>Policy on computer provisioning (VPS-32)</li>
<li>Policy on computing facilities (VPS-30)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ol>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<p>The unit's key goals are:</p>
<ul>
<li>To provide consultative and professional services in support of training and development activities for our employees throughout the university.</li>
<li>To assess training and development needs and to design and implement programs that address the specific requirements of staff and management.</li>
<li>Successful integration of our employees by ensuring we provide an enriching New Employee Orientation program.</li>
<li>Provide advice to our employees and managers on a broad range of training and development topics.</li>
<li>Advise on possible skills and retraining requirements.</li>
<li>Create and diffuse training and tools on a broad variety of topics.</li>
</ul>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<h1>Faculty &amp; library positions</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Positions are divided into the following areas:</p>
<ul>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="/hr/jobs/openings/faculty-library-positions.html#arts-science">Arts and Science</a></li>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="/hr/jobs/openings/faculty-library-positions.html#engineering">Engineering and Computer Science</a></li>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="/hr/jobs/openings/faculty-library-positions.html#fine-arts">Fine Arts</a></li>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="/hr/jobs/openings/faculty-library-positions.html#jmsb">John Molson School of Business</a></li>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="/hr/jobs/openings/faculty-library-positions.html#graduate">School of Graduate Studies</a></li>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="http://library.concordia.ca/about/jobs/">Concordia University Libraries</a></li>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="/hr/jobs/openings/faculty-library-positions.html#coned">Centre for Continuing Education</a></li>
</ul>

<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        <a name="arts-science"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Arts and Science">
					
                    Arts and Science
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase box section">









<div class="c-sidebar-calltoaction bloc link-color-dark with-border" style=" color: # !important;   padding: 10px 10px 10px 20px;">


    <h2 class="section-header" style='color: # !important; '></h2>
    <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><a target="_new" href="http://artsandscience.concordia.ca/employmentopportunities/">Jobs available</a> in the <a href="http://artsandscience.concordia.ca/">Faculty of Arts and Science</a></p>

</div></div>


</div>



</div>

</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>The Faculty of Arts and Science is the largest of Concordia's four Faculties, offering more than 170 undergraduate programs and 50 graduate programs in 27 academic departments and colleges, encompassing the Sciences, Social Sciences and Humanities. Our dedication and commitment to offering outstanding academic programs is exemplified by the top international rankings enjoyed by several of our academic units.</p>
<p>Through the auspices of the Knowledge Infrastructure Program, a collaborative funding program of the Federal and Provincial governments, the university received more than $64 million in funding to support two initiatives of the Faculty of Arts and Science: the Centre for Structural and Functional Genomics and the PERFORM Centre. In total, the Faculty houses or is affiliated with more than 20 research centres, bringing together top researchers from across the university.</p>
<p>The Faculty is dedicated to superior teaching and research supported by excellence in scholarship and creative activity. It also boasts a strong tradition of service to the community. Over the course of its history, the Faculty has evolved into a dynamic learning environment that promotes student-centered learning, flexibility, interdisciplinary thinking, and research.</p>
<p>Since 2002, the Faculty has hired more than 240 tenured and tenure-track professorsâculled from thousands of applicants worldwideâwho are among the most promising teachers and researchers in their fields. These new professors have attracted millions of external research funding each year, thereby enriching Concordiaâs research landscape.</p>
<h5>How to apply</h5>
<ul>
<li>Visit the Facultyâs <a href="http://artsandscience.concordia.ca/employmentopportunities/">Employment Opportunities</a> section to learn more about how to submit an application.</li>
</ul>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>

        <a name="engineering"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Engineering and Computer Science">
					
                    Engineering and Computer Science
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_0" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase box section">









<div class="c-sidebar-calltoaction bloc link-color-dark with-border" style=" color: # !important;   padding: 10px 10px 10px 20px;">


    <h2 class="section-header" style='color: # !important; '></h2>
    <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><a href="http://encs.concordia.ca/administration-and-governance/jobs/">Jobs available</a> in the <a href="http://encs.concordia.ca/" class="external">Faculty of Engineering and Computer Science</a></p>

</div></div>


</div>



</div>

</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Concordia University's Faculty of Engineering and Computer Science is one of the &quot;G15&quot; major engineering schools in Canada. In the last ten years, it has achieved the highest growth rate of engineering schools in Canada in both graduate and undergraduate enrolment and has one of the youngest professoriate among engineering schools in the country. It has established a strong Canadian and International reputation in research and development.</p>
<h5>Celebrating Excellence, Innovation and Professionalism</h5>
<p>The Faculty of Engineering and Computer Science offers our multi-cultural student body a vast choice of exciting programs, courses and cutting edge research opportunities in a high quality learning environment equipped with outstanding state-of-the-art facilities.</p>
<p>Candidates seeking a challenging and dynamic learning environment are invited to apply for the following full-time, tenure-track faculty position at the Assistant, Associate or Full Professor level. Applicants will be expected to excel in teaching courses at the undergraduate and graduate levels as well as supervise M.A. Sc., Ph.D. students. They must be able to conduct independent scholarly research and attract strong external funding.</p>
<p>Electronic applications are preferred and should be sent to the appropriate department contact by email; hard copies may be sent c/o Concordia University, 1455 de Maisonneuve Blvd. West, Montreal, Quebec H3G 1M8. Applications should consist of a letter of intent, current CV, a list of publications, a statement of teaching philosophy and interests, evidence of teaching effectiveness, a statement of interests and achievements, copies of recent publications, and the names of three referees. Only short-listed candidates will be notified.</p>
<h5>How to apply</h5>
<ul>
<li>Visit the <a class="external" href="http://encs.concordia.ca/">Faculty of Engineering and Computer Science</a>.</li>
</ul>

<div class="rte">
<p>Concordia University's Faculty of Fine Arts is unique in Canada. We offer, in a single faculty, an unparalleled range of fine arts programs across nine departments and three research institutes.</p>
<p>We have experienced considerable growth since 1996, with a large increase in student enrolment, construction of state-of-the-art facilities, increased external research funding and vigorous faculty renewal.</p>
<p>Our acclaimed faculty are artists and scholars dedicated to creative work and research. Their passion for teaching and research is the cornerstone of our reputation.</p>

<div class="rte">
<p>The John Molson School of Business (JMSB), one of Canada's leading business schools, is named after one of the country's most prestigious business leaders. John Molson's success as an entrepreneur is a key source of inspiration for our school's high academic standards, commitment to business excellence, and entrepreneurial spirit.</p>
<p>The JMSB has five departments and is AACSB accredited. A full range of programs are offered at both the undergraduate and graduate levels. Graduate programs include an MSc in Business Administration, MBA programs (Executive, Investment Management), and a joint PhD program.</p>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="post highlighted">            
                <h1 class="article-title">Code exists to protect</h1>
                
                <div class="subtitle">Concordia's Code of Rights and Responsibilities governs behaviour and protects individuals' rights on campus</div>
                
                <div class="clearfix"></div>
                <div class="infos">
	                <div class="date">Posted on September 12, 2012</div>
	                <div class="separator">|</div>
	                <div class="author">
	                   <div class="author parbase picker">






	<span>By: Tom Peacock</span>
</div>

	                </div>
	                <div class="source">
	                   <div class="single source">





</div>
                
                    </div>
                </div>
                
                <div class="rte">
                    <div class="parbase details wysiwyg">



<div class="rte">
<p><i>This article is the first in a series of seven weekly articles being published on the topic of important Concordia policies. It is essential for all employees to familiarize themselves with these policies, as they will be asked to confirm to respect and adhere to them electronically via </i>my empath<i> in the MyConcordia portal following the publication of the last story.</i></p><p>It&rsquo;s the beginning of another school year, and Concordia&rsquo;s Director and Senior Advisor on Rights and Responsibilities Louise Shiller is making the rounds of orientation sessions, educating new members of the Concordia community about the Code of Rights and Responsibilities. <br /> <br /> Concordia&rsquo;s behavioural code of conduct does not discriminate, she explains to her audiences. It applies to everyone &mdash; students, staff, and faculty. &ldquo;The code outlines the responsibilities that you have as a member of this community,&rdquo; she says. &ldquo;It also outlines your rights and, if those rights are violated, the steps for resolution and potential recourses that are available to you.&rdquo;</p><div class="img_wrapper" style="float:right; display:inline; margin:0 0 1em 15px; width:350px;"><div class="inner_shadow"><img width="350" height="233" src="code-exists-to-protect-not-to-punish/_jcr_content/images/image_jpg_0.img.jpg" alt=""/></div></div><p>Academic and policy issues are not covered in the Code of Rights and Responsibilities, but rather in the Terms of Reference of the Ombuds Office. In rare cases there is overlap, and Shiller says anyone who&rsquo;s not sure where to go can call either the Ombuds Office or her office, and be steered in the right direction.<br /> <br /> Shiller says she doesn&rsquo;t expect every member of the community to read the entire code. &ldquo;Common sense should guide you in how you treat people,&rdquo; she says. &ldquo;We&rsquo;re promoting respect and a healthy working environment on campus for students, staff and faculty, and most people intuitively know these things.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> However, if questions do arise about behaviour, she adds, the code outlines in detail what sorts of things are prohibited &mdash; sexual and psychological harassment, forgery, theft, and threatening or violent behavior&nbsp; are just some examples pulled from the long list.<br /> <br /> Sometimes, behavioural infractions covered by the Code of Rights and Responsibilities are resolved before they are even brought to Shiller&rsquo;s attention. &ldquo;For example, if a student is being harassed, or a faculty member, they may go to the chair of their department, or an associate dean, and it may be resolved at that level, which is appropriate,&rdquo; she says.<br /> <br /> &ldquo;But sometimes they&rsquo;ll come to me and say they&rsquo;re not sure what to do. We&rsquo;ll review the options available together and I may assist in reaching an informal resolution or engaging in a formal process. If I can assist them and it&rsquo;s appropriate, I do.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> Even so, most cases that end up on Shiller&rsquo;s desk at the Office of Rights and Responsibilities, located on the 11th floor of the Guy-Metro (GM) Building, can be resolved informally; in other words, without a formal complaint being lodged and without a hearing or formal investigation taking place. Often visitors are simply seeking advice and tools on how to deal with a situation themselves. <br /> <br /> On occasion, however, a visitor to the office may request that someone intervene on their behalf. In this case, Shiller will either act as a mediator herself, or she will enlist the help of someone who should be involved with the case to help.<br /> <br /> If she has to intervene on behalf of a member of the university, Shiller always steadfastly maintains impartiality, giving people from both sides of a conflict equal time to provide their side of the story.. <br /> <br /> As is stated in the code, &ldquo;All members of the university &hellip; may reasonably expect to pursue their work, studies and other activities related to university life in a safe and civil environment.&rdquo; Concordia&rsquo;s Code of Rights and Responsibilities exists to ensure that this fundamental right enjoyed by each and every student, staff and faculty member at the university is protected.<br /> <br /> <b>Related links:</b><br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Code of Rights and Responsibilities&nbsp; <br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <a href="http://rights.concordia.ca/">Office of Rights and Responsibilities</a>&nbsp; <br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ombuds Office&nbsp; <br /> <br /> <br /> <br /> <br /> <br /> <br /> <br /> &nbsp;</p> 
</div></div>

                </div>
                <div class="parsys">




</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="post highlighted">            
                <h1 class="article-title">Policy awareness campaign highlights employee Code of Ethics</h1>
                
                <div class="subtitle">Code outlines rules of conduct for addressing potential conflicts of interest and mechanism for safe disclosure</div>
                
                <div class="clearfix"></div>
                <div class="infos">
	                <div class="date">Posted on September 18, 2012</div>
	                <div class="separator">|</div>
	                <div class="author">
	                   <div class="author parbase picker">






	<span>By: Isabel Rut</span>
</div>

	                </div>
	                <div class="source">
	                   <div class="single source">





</div>
                
                    </div>
                </div>
                
                <div class="rte">
                    <div class="parbase details wysiwyg">



<div class="rte">
<p><i>This article is the second in a series of seven weekly articles being published on important Concordia policies. This is part of a policy awareness campaign that will culminate in employees being asked to confirm that they have read the policies when they access the </i>myempath<i> application on MyConcordia portal following the publication of the last story.</i></p> <p>It is not always easy to determine what constitutes ethical behaviour. Whether accepting a gift from a supplier or providing information to an individual that may be considered confidential is a conflict of interest, or simply an acceptable interaction, is not always clear to employees.</p><div style="float:right; display:inline; margin:0 0 1em 15px; width:350px;" class="img_wrapper"><div class="inner_shadow"><img width="350" height="233" alt="" src="policy-awareness-campaign-highlights-employee-code-of-ethics/_jcr_content/images/image_jpg_0.img.jpg"/></div></div><p>&ldquo;The Concordia Code of Ethics and Safe Disclosure Policy identifies potential conflicts of interest and helps employees evaluate situations to determine their best course of action,&rdquo; says Vice-President, Institutional Relations and Secretary-General, Bram Freedman. &ldquo;This policy clarifies the position of ethical conduct and provides for a mechanism to safely disclose situations that may reflect poorly on the reputation of our university.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> As defined by the Policy BD-4 (Code of Ethics and Safe Disclosure Policy), a conflict of interest is presented as a situation where an employee knowingly has a personal interest, which is sufficient to put into question the independence, impartiality and objectivity necessary to exercise the performance of their duties.<br /> <br /> The policy identifies potential situations where a conflict of interest is at risk:&nbsp;</p> <ul>     <li>Interest in a contract on behalf of the university where an employee may obtain personal advantage or benefit as a result of a decision made.</li>     <li>When an employee accepts gifts, gratuities or favours from a person engaged in or wishing to engage in transactions with the university, except in the case of customary gifts of a trivial value.</li>     <li>When an employee uses their position to give real or perceived preferential treatment in dealings with the university.</li>     <li>When an employee uses information obtained in the performance of their duties, which is not generally communicated to the public, for their own advantage.</li>     <li>When an employee uses or allows others to use the university&rsquo;s goods or services, for activities other than those approved by the university, for their own advantage.</li>     <li>Supervision of an immediate relative unless specified within the parameters of the policy.</li> </ul> <p>Employees are encouraged to speak with their immediate supervisor in any case where there may be a conflict of interest. If warranted, a course of action will be agreed upon, documented and submitted to the secretary general.<br /> <br /> &ldquo;At Concordia, all employees, whether they are senior officers, faculty members, administrative or support staff, are expected to conduct themselves in an ethical and professional manner, and make decisions dilligently in the best interests of the university,&rdquo; says Carolina Willsher, associate vice-president, Human Resources.<br /> <br /> This policy also provides employees with a method of safe disclosure. They can submit a confidential report to the university&rsquo;s president, the secretary-general, or the current chair of the Audit Committee of the Board of Governors, either in writing or by calling 514-848-2424, ext. 2383. The number will not disclose caller identification, and callers are given directions for leaving a message for whichever one of the three individuals they are most comfortable contacting.<br /> <br /> It is important to note that this method of safe disclosure is for complaints about behaviour covered by the Code of Ethics. If someone&rsquo;s behaviour on campus is threatening, it should be reported to the Office of Rights and Responsibilities.<br /> <br /> All Concordia employees are encouraged to review the Code of Ethics for more details. Additionally, there are a range of other important policies available on the Concordia website that have been developed to clarify ambiguous conditions that may be relevant to employees within specific departments. Pleaser refer to the question and answer section on the Human Resources page under policies and procedures for a full list of policies related to the awareness campaign.<br /> <b><br /> Related links:</b><br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Code exists to protect&quot; &mdash; NOW, September 12, 2012&nbsp; <br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; BD-4, Code of Ethics and Safe Disclosure Policy <br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Official Concordia policies website <br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <a href="http://rights.concordia.ca/">Office of Rights and Responsibilities </a><br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Human Resources web page <br /> &nbsp;</p> 
</div></div>

                </div>
                <div class="parsys">




</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

        <div class="span8">
            <div class="post highlighted">            
                <h1 class="article-title">Protecting personal information</h1>
                
                <div class="subtitle">University policy safeguards personal information</div>
                
                <div class="clearfix"></div>
                <div class="infos">
	                <div class="date">Posted on September 25, 2012</div>
	                <div class="separator">|</div>
	                <div class="author">
	                   <div class="author parbase picker">






	<span>By: Isabel Rut</span>
</div>

	                </div>
	                <div class="source">
	                   <div class="single source">





</div>
                
                    </div>
                </div>
                
                <div class="rte">
                    <div class="parbase details wysiwyg">



<div class="rte">
<p><i>This article is the third in a series of seven, published weekly on important Concordia policies. This is part of a policy-awareness campaign that will culminate in employees being asked to confirm that they have read the policies when they access </i>my empath<i> in the MyConcordia portal following the publication of the last story.</i></p> <p>It is amazing what can be done with just a little personal information. A social insurance number, a date of birth or an address can provide enough information for someone to commit identity theft. Passports, credit cards and other sensitive documents can be created using simple personal information.&nbsp;</p>  <p>Protecting personal information is important. This is why Concordia maintains a strict policy concerning the protection of personal information and is in compliance with the Act Respecting Access to Documents Held by Public Bodies and the Protection of Personal Information, established by the Government of Quebec.</p><div class="img_wrapper" style="float:right; display:inline; margin:0 0 1em 15px; width:350px;"><div class="inner_shadow"><img width="350" height="233" src="protecting-personal-information/_jcr_content/images/image_jpg_0.img.jpg" alt="Employees should exercise discretion and diligence with personal information."/></div> <div class="caption">Employees should exercise discretion and diligence with personal information.</div></div><p>&ldquo;Essentially, all information is considered confidential except in specific cases provided by the law,&rdquo; says Vice-President, Institutional Relations and Secretary-General, Bram Freedman.<br /> <br /> Concordia's Policy Concerning the Protection of Personal Information (VPIRSG-9) outlines specific guidelines and situations on how an employee may collect, access or process personal information.<br /> <br /> In addition, the policy refers to the proper disposal of any obsolete documents containing personal information that has not been archived. In this case, the documents would be shredded or recycled as prescribed by Concordia's Policy on Records Management and Archives (VPIRSG-10). <br /> <br /> Online fraud is widespread and often anonymous, making the protection of personal information essential. An omission, a neglected file or a seemingly innocent query in which personal information is made available may result in unintended consequences for an employee. The policy is designed to ensure that employees are confident their personal information is managed and stored securely within the confines of the university.<br /> <br /> All Concordia employees are encouraged to review the Policy Concerning the Protection of Personal Information for more details. Additionally, there is a range of other important policies available on this site that have been developed to clarify ambiguous conditions, which may be relevant to employees within specific departments. See the question and answer section on the Human Resources page under policies and procedures for a full list of policies related to the awareness campaign.<br /> <b><br /> Related links:</b><br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&quot;Code exists to protect&quot; &mdash; NOW, September 12, 2012<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &quot;Policy awareness campaign highlights employee Code of Ethics&quot; &mdash; NOW, September 19, 2012&nbsp; <br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; Policy Concerning the Protection of Personal Information (VPIRSG-9) <br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; Policy on Records Management and Archives (VPIRSG-10)<br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; Concordia official policies website&nbsp; <br /> <br /> <br /> <br /> <br /> <br /> &nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p> 
</div></div>

                </div>
                <div class="parsys">




</div>

                <hr>
                <div class="related-links parbase picker">






</div>
